# Day 1167

**"The path to wealth is through capability." - Michael Saylor**

![[https://youtu.be/reVebuAf_Cs](https://youtu.be/reVebuAf_Cs)](https://miro.medium.com/1*0fb7MdAL-aXIam9iaFmRBw.png)

Instead of chasing wealth directly, build capability.
Instead of trying to scheme your way to riches, train yourself.
Become antifragile. Capable. Useful. Dangerous in a good way.

That's the kind of wealth nobody can inflate or seize.
Literally. Not when your savings live in 12 words instead of a bank account.
_Not when your capital is Bitcoin._

Capability isn't just having skills.
It's about knowing what to do when the system fails, because one day it probably will.
It's clarity under pressure. It's self-reliance when trust evaporates.
It's knowing how to hold your own keys, and hold your own line.

In 2025, capability looks radically different than it did even five years ago.
You now have access to a hundred supergeniuses, on-demand, by opening a browser and querying the mind of your favorite LLM.
The AI isn't just a tool. It's a forge.

Bitcoin, too, is a forge.
It sharpens your thinking. Forces time preference downward.
Teaches you to see through noise.
And rewards those who build instead of beg.

I don't know what capability will look like five years from now.
But I know it will be forged by two tools: **AI and Bitcoin.**
One helps you think faster.
The other helps you store value that can't be seized, censored, or debased.
One is mental leverage. The other is monetary sovereignty.
Together, they let you do more with less, and save more in something real.

Build with one. Save with the other.
That's the new capability.
The new elite are not going to be the ones born into power.
They will be the ones who ask better questions, faster, and _own_ the results.

**This is The Saylor Strategy (Execution):**

- Ask the AI before you ask the lawyer.

- Solve the problem before you pass it to your team.

- Buy Bitcoin before you raise capital.

- Build leverage before you need it.

- Tell the story before they write it for you.

**The Saylor Doctrine (Communication):**

- Explain your strategy before anyone asks.

- Communicate your mission before they doubt your motives.

- Define your intent before someone else does it for you.

- State your mission before they question your methods.

- Name your principles before they're tested.

Capability means execution.
It means precision.
It means speed and the freedom to act without permission.

The world doesn't need more opinions.
It needs more people who can get shit done _without asking_.
So don't wait for the degree, the title, the grant, the nod.

Train your mind. Sharpen your tools. Stack your sats.
**Hold your keys. Build your fortress.**

Because the path to wealth, the durable, sovereign kind, goes straight through capability.

And every other path?

It probably leads right back to fiat.

6/1/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
